abstract: The new Everex gPC TC2502 computer runs GOS, a version of Linux specially designed to run Google applications like GMail and Google Documents.
snippet: The new Everex gPC TC2502 computer runs GOS, a version of Linux specially designed to run Google applications like GMail and Google Documents.
lead_paragraph: Advocates of Linux, the free open-source operating system, like to say that buying a standard-issue computer involves a Microsoft Tax, because you have no choice but to pay for Windows. New versions of Linux and inexpensive hardware like the new Everex gPC TC2502 make that tax avoidable.

headline.main: Circuits: A Computer That Works With Google, Not Microsoft
headline.print_headline: Circuits: A Computer That Works With Google, Not Microsoft

abstract: Google’s new OpenSocial initiative is nifty technology, but it’s not a product that in itself will cause any trouble for Facebook or MySpace.
snippet: Google’s new OpenSocial initiative is nifty technology, but it’s not a product that in itself will cause any trouble for Facebook or MySpace.
lead_paragraph: For the last year, Sergey Brin has been campaigning at Google with the slogan “features not products” in an attempt to reduce the sprawl of the company’s eccentric creativity.

headline.main: Google’s OpenSocial Is Not a Facebook Killer

abstract: Breaking News: MySpace joins Google’s OpenSocial team.
snippet: Breaking News: MySpace joins Google’s OpenSocial team.
lead_paragraph: Breaking now: MySpace, the Web’s largest social network with more than 110 million members, has joined Google’s OpenSocial platform. The New York Times wrote about the effort, designed to counter Facebook, on Tuesday.

headline.main: MySpace Joins the Google OpenSocial Team
